result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Defendant Paris G Crossley in court with Attorney William Joseph Reddin.  Defendant Paris G Crossley in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Plea hearing.  AS TO COUNT #1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 14CF4053 AND 15CF613 for the purposes of sentencing.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Defendant Paris G Crossley in court with Attorney William Joseph Reddin.  Defendant Paris G Crossley in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter is here for a Plea Hearing.  There is a possible global resolution with all cases.  The matter is adjourned for a status conference on December 18, 2015 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.

Attorney William Joseph Reddin in court, defendant Paris G Crossley not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Paris G Crossley in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Defendant Paris G Crossley in custody.  
David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
eputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Doctor's Report Return.  Hearing proceeded.  There being no challenge to the report of Dr. Kevin Murtaugh M.D. dated 8-27-15 by the state, defense counsel or defendant, the court found the defendant competent to proceed and ordered the proceedings reinstated.  Bail as ordered prior to case being suspended (5,000 CASH).  Parties in a contest posture as to defendant's other matters (14CF004053 and 15CF000613).  Denis Stingl for the State now present; dates selected. This case to follow along for status at this time.  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from Dr. Kevin Murtaugh dated 8/27/15, filed.

Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg in court, defendant Paris G Crossley not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a doctor's report return.  Defendant was suppose to be examined.  The defendant just arrived at Mendota on August 14, 2015.  Examination has not been completed.  Defendant being uncooperative.  Defendant remanded into custody once the examination is completed.  Bail needs to be reinstated at next hearing.

Matter adjourned to September 2, 2015 at 8:30am in Judge Conen's Court, Br. 30
Deputy Court Clerk:  tg
as to the defendant prepared by psychologist, Dr. Deborah Collins; filed.

Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg in court, defendant Paris G Crossley not in court, in custody.  David Robles for Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The doctor's report is not yet completed.
 ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.
Case adjourned to 08-18-2015 at 9:00 AM - Br. 30, Judge Conen's Court for Adjourned Return on Doctor's Report.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE FACILITY FOR PURPOSES OF THE RETURN ON DOCTOR'S REPORT IN BRANCH 2.

Defense raises competency on behalf of his client. Court ordered a Competency Evaluation. Court suspended proceedings.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed with court.

Defendant Paris G Crossley in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Defendant Paris G Crossley in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Geronimo PC or Co-Defendant Kevin Moore

Defendant Paris G Crossley in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Paris G Crossley in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case of Co-Defendant this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
